Posts.Content: Apr 21, 2014 06:50PM critterzmom wrote: Love the analogy!   Even though I'm five months out from dx, I still feel like I'm in the shell shocked category - mostly numb with intermittent crying jags that usually don't last too long.  The disaster we are most familiar with here is tornadoes, and I find myself mentally wandering through the rubble  much of the time, but every so often finding something really precious that brings me back to the place where the joy is.   My canine family is my rock, and my latest source of joy the 11 3-week old puppies and their mom that I am fostering. I've always been the "strong one" and I'm not at all good at reaching out to family and friends.
Posts.Title: We are our own Natural Disaster Mzmerz critterzmom

Posts.Content: critterzmom wrote: Several weeks ago I underwent surgery for an intestinal obstruction that according to the pathology was actually metastatic breast cancer. I have undergone many diagnostic procedures (CTs, MRIs, PET scan, lumbar puncture) in an attempt to locate the primary source, with no luck, and there are no other indications of metastatic disease. I am currently on hormone therapy. Can anyone share experiences or suggest sources of information for this situation? My oncologist has been pretty patient with my questions but I still don't feel like I have enough information to make the decisions that have to be made at this point. Thanks for any help! Dx 11/20/2013, 6cm+, Stage IV, 38/40 nodes, mets, ER+ Hormonal Therapy 12/5/2013 Femara (letrozole) Hormonal Therapy 2/15/2014 Arimidex (anastrozole) Log in to post a reply
